title: Upgrade @cloudflare/vitest-pool-workers for vitest 4.x support
description:
**Blocker Issue**

The project uses vitest 4.0.17, but @cloudflare/vitest-pool-workers 0.12.3 only supports vitest 2.0.x - 3.2.x.

This blocks all tests that require cloudflare:test (real miniflare runtime).

**Affected Tests:**
- objects/tests/storage-stores-comprehensive.test.ts
- Any test importing from cloudflare:test or cloudflare:workers

**External Tracking:**
- GitHub Issue: https://github.com/cloudflare/workers-sdk/issues/11064
- PR in progress: https://github.com/cloudflare/workers-sdk/pull/11632

**Resolution:**
Wait for @cloudflare/vitest-pool-workers to release vitest 4.x support, then upgrade the package.

**Workaround:**
Run unit tests with mocked databases (stores-*.test.ts) which verify core logic without Workers runtime.

title: @dotdo/core - Foundational DO runtime package
description:
Create `@dotdo/core` package to enable packages like `@dotdo/fsx`, `@dotdo/gitx`, and `@mdxui/do` to depend on core DO primitives without circular dependencies.

## Problem
Currently dotdo has circular dependency issues - fsx/gitx need base DO but dotdo depends on them.

## Solution
Extract foundational DO runtime into `@dotdo/core`:

```
core/
├── index.ts           # Main exports
├── DO.ts              # Minimal DO base (SQLite + optional identity)
├── DB.ts              # Schema extension API (wraps ai-database)
├── context.ts         # WorkflowContext ($)
├── rpc/
│   ├── target.ts      # Cap'n Web RPC target
│   ├── router.ts      # REST router
│   └── client.ts      # RPC client
└── package.json
```

## Key Design Decisions

1. **Minimal DO base** - Just SQLite/Drizzle + optional identity
2. **Schema extension API** - `DO.with(schema)` pattern for extending Drizzle
3. **No concrete stores** - Stores stay in `db/stores/` in dotdo
4. **Depends on `@org.ai/types`** - Foundational types live there
5. **Uses `ai-database`** - For DB() DSL with `->`, `~>`, `<-`, `<~` operators

## Dependency Graph

```
dotdo → @dotdo/fsx, @dotdo/gitx, @mdxui/do
            ↓
      @dotdo/core
            ↓
    ai-database + @org.ai/types
```

title: CLI DX: Auto-create user's default DO when none exist
description:
Current DX is terrible: when user runs `dotdo repl` with no workers, it shows "No workers found. Deploy a DO first."

Should instead:
1. Every user should have a default personal DO at `{username}.do` or similar
2. If no workers exist, auto-create a dev DO for the user
3. The REPL should "just work" out of the box

Flow should be:
```
dotdo repl
> Connecting to your personal DO (nathan.do)...
> Connected! Type code to execute.
$> 
```

Not:
```
dotdo repl
[error] No workers found. Deploy a DO first.
```

This requires:
1. CLI to detect "no workers" and offer to create one
2. Or default to user's personal DO namespace
3. workers.do to support creating DOs on-the-fly

title: Fix workers.do capnweb RPC - returns JSON instead of RPC

3. DO's fetch handler should handle RPC requests

title: [RED] Graph Traversal - Verify/write comprehensive tests
description:
TDD RED: Verify existing tests or write new failing tests.

## Test Coverage Required
Basic Operations:
- createNode, getNode, updateNode, deleteNode
- createEdge, getEdge, deleteEdge
- queryNodes with filters
- queryEdges with filters

Traversals:
- BFS from node
- DFS from node
- Multi-hop paths
- Shortest path (Dijkstra)
- All paths between nodes

Pattern Matching:
- Single pattern (A)-[r]->(B)
- Multi-hop pattern (A)-[*2..3]->(B)
- Filtered patterns

Algorithms:
- PageRank
- Betweenness centrality
- Connected components
- Clustering coefficient

## Acceptance Criteria
- Tests in objects/tests/do-graph-*.test.ts or db/graph/tests/
- All tests use cloudflare:test
- Tests verify real behavior
notes:
## Graph Traversal Test Coverage Analysis

### Test Files Summary (56 test files, ~58,725 lines total)

**Key traversal test files:**
- `traversal-engine.test.ts` (84 tests) - BFS/DFS, path finding, cycle detection
- `graph.test.ts` (119 tests) - GraphEngine CRUD, traversal, pattern matching
- `algorithms.test.ts` (36 tests) - Connected components, centrality, Dijkstra, MST, topological sort
- `distributed-traversal.test.ts` (53 tests) - Multi-hop, batching, parallel, caching

### Coverage Status

**IMPLEMENTED in GraphEngine (graph-engine.ts):**
- createNode, getNode, updateNode, deleteNode
- createEdge, getEdge, updateEdge, deleteEdge
- queryNodes, queryEdges
- traverse (BFS), traverseDFS (DFS)
- neighbors (immediate neighbors)
- shortestPath, allPaths, pathExists
- match (pattern matching), matchCypher
- degree, degreeCentrality, betweennessCentrality, pageRank
- commonNeighbors, clusteringCoefficient
- connectedComponents, stronglyConnectedComponents, isConnected, largestComponent
- closenessCentrality, dijkstra, minimumSpanningTree
- topologicalSort, hasCycles
- eccentricity, diameter, radius, center

**TEST COVERAGE GAPS:**
- Tests use `cloudflare:test`: NO - tests use standard vitest
- Mocks used: NO (good - per CLAUDE.md philosophy)
- Tests currently FAILING due to missing `nanoid` dependency in tool-invocation.ts

### Blocking Issue
All graph tests fail to run because db/graph/index.ts imports tool-invocation.ts which imports `nanoid`, but `nanoid` is not a direct dependency (only a transitive one from vite/postcss).

### Recommendation
1. Add `nanoid` as direct dependency OR
2. Replace nanoid with crypto.randomUUID() in tool-invocation.ts
3. Then verify test suite passes

title: Review and remove mock DO test harness
description:
## CRITICAL: Real features with ZERO real test coverage

These DO lifecycle operations exist in DOFull.ts but have NO tests using cloudflare:test:

| Operation | Implementation | Real Tests | Status |
|-----------|---------------|------------|--------|
| fork() | DOFull.ts:493 | 0 | ❌ UNTESTED |
| compact() | DOFull.ts:563 | 0 | ❌ UNTESTED |
| clone() | DOFull.ts:751 | 0 | ❌ UNTESTED |
| promote() | DOFull.ts:1513 | 0 | ❌ UNTESTED |
| demote() | DOFull.ts:1615 | 0 | ❌ UNTESTED |
| merge() | DOFull.ts:1871 | 0 | ❌ UNTESTED |
| shard() | DOFull.ts:2356 | 0 | ❌ UNTESTED |
| unshard() | DOFull.ts:2405 | 0 | ❌ UNTESTED |

## Problem
48 test files use mock harness (tests/harness/do.ts) instead of cloudflare:test.
These mock tests test FAKE behavior that may differ from production.

## Action Required
1. DELETE all mock tests - they provide false confidence
2. CREATE real tests using cloudflare:test for each operation
3. DELETE tests/harness/do.ts and tests/harness/do.test.ts

## Mock test files to delete
- tests/acid/phase1/*.test.ts (9 files)
- tests/acid/phase2/*.test.ts (6 files)  
- tests/acid/phase3/*.test.ts (10 files)
- tests/acid/phase6/*.test.ts (4 files)
- db/tests/replication/*.test.ts (5 files)
- tests/objects/*.test.ts (4 files)
- objects/tests/do-promote.test.ts, do-demote.test.ts, do-clone.test.ts

## Real test pattern (from do-rpc.test.ts)
```typescript
import { env } from 'cloudflare:test'

const stub = env.DO.get(env.DO.idFromName('test'))
await stub.clone('target-ns')  // Test real behavior
```
close_reason: Mock DO test harness removed, replaced with real cloudflare:test tests for clone/fork, promote/demote, shard/unshard, compact/merge operations

title: Cross-Store Comparisons
description:

| Records | Document Writes | Columnar Writes | Savings |
|---------|-----------------|-----------------|---------|

| 10,000  | 10,000 ($0.01)  | 6 ($0.000006)   | 99.94%  |

title: Remote Benchmark Runner
description:
Run benchmarks on live Cloudflare Workers for production comparison.

## Components
1. **Benchmark Worker** - Deployed worker that executes benchmarks
2. **Remote Protocol** - HTTP API for benchmark execution
3. **Result Aggregation** - Collect and merge remote results
4. **Local vs Remote Comparison** - Side-by-side analysis

## Files
- tests/benchmarks/workers/benchmark-runner/index.ts - Worker entry
- tests/benchmarks/workers/benchmark-runner/wrangler.toml - Deploy config
- tests/benchmarks/framework/remote.ts - Remote execution client
- tests/benchmarks/framework/compare.ts - Local vs remote comparison

## Protocol
```typescript
// POST /benchmark
interface BenchmarkRequest {
  store: string
  operation: string
  dataset: DatasetConfig
  iterations: number
  warmup: number
}

interface BenchmarkResponse {
  metrics: BenchmarkMetrics
  raw: number[]  // Individual samples
  environment: 'production'
}
```

## Considerations
- Authentication (API key or Workers Auth)
- Timeout handling (max 30s CPU time)
- Large dataset streaming
- Cost of running benchmarks on production

title: Epic: Location-Aware Replica Routing
description:
Implement location-aware routing for read replicas in the API layer. This enables low-latency reads by routing to the nearest replica while maintaining consistency guarantees.

## Goals
- Extract location from Cloudflare request metadata
- Extend nouns schema with replica configuration
- Implement nearest-replica selection algorithm
- Support multiple consistency modes (strong, eventual, causal)
- Integrate replica routing into getDOBinding()

## Architecture
- Primary DO handles all writes
- Read replicas handle read traffic based on consistency mode
- Location hints guide CF to prefer certain regions
- Nouns table defines per-collection replica strategy

title: Create unified events pipeline utility
description:
Create a utility that sends all events to a pipeline:

1. Check for EVENTS binding (Pipeline) from `import { env } from 'cloudflare:workers'`
2. If EVENTS binding exists → use `env.EVENTS.send()`
3. If no binding → HTTP POST to workers.do/events (multi-tenant endpoint)

The workers.do/events endpoint is a snippet that forwards to Pipeline HTTP endpoint.

This replaces:
- The wrong "dev in-memory sink" pattern
- The ANALYTICS binding misuse
- The console.log-only routing telemetry

All events (routing, usage, RPC metering) should flow through this single utility.
close_reason: Created lib/events/pipeline.ts with unified events pipeline utility. Uses EVENTS binding if available, falls back to HTTP POST to workers.do/events. 26 tests passing.
